    Customizing forms -- NF example

    Customizing forms -- NF example

    customizing-forms-NF-example.Rmd

    Intro

    This vignette provides a walk-through of actual usage for the NF project, focusing on the DSP form. To provide some context, NF groups projects under 4 different funding mechanisms/agencies (though there can be overlap or co-funding for projects), which are:

    • NTAP
    • CTF
    • GFF
    • DHART-SPORE

    Hence, there needs to be four versions of the forms. We show the setup and adaptation of the base form to varying degrees for each version.

    See also related vignettes (TO DO):

    • More complicated customizations
    • Retrieve JSON data and generate PDF

    Organization

    First, we organize things by creating a directory for each of the funders (see on GitHub).

    Then, in CTF for example, we set up version 1 of the DSP with:

    formd::draftStandardDSP(version = "v1")

    This creates a folder called DSP_Standard_v1 (see on GitHub).

    In this manner, future newer versions of the same form, or other form types are located in their own form folders.

    Adaptation

    As mentioned, forms can be adapted to varying degrees. The more your use case departs from NF, the more you will have to think about this process. For NF, the different levels of tweaking are summarized in the table below. Note that NTAP and CTF were the original templates, so there were no real customizations for these.

    Column description:

    • Funder: Label of funder version.
    • Doc: The original Word/Google docs version
    • Commit: Actual commit showing how parameters/files are customized in Rmarkdown; use as comparisons/examples of what might be expected.
    • Degree: Relative degree of customization; this is also obvious by looking at param/file changes in the linked commit.
    • Html: Live version of HTML form when rendered (after the custom commit / suggestion to compare with doc version)
    Funder Doc Commit Degree Html
    CTF https://docs.google.com/document/d/1fhtjpvq1r4-QqB9YjG5KICW4pPDtRQpKkdlhPN1xMbk https://github.com/nf-osi/forms/commit/9ebe5d260a5d0e3e06c5702d99e0edcba5acd170 basic params https://nf-osi.github.io/forms/CTF/DSP_Standard_v1/DSP_Standard_v1.html
    NTAP https://docs.google.com/document/d/1aa7061ekrk5qbFVnB7pRahnN1hDd0Ut_090QzdP0UyU https://github.com/nf-osi/forms/commit/25cae2d8785e6d23103db40d4d55776bda92a9e1 basic params https://nf-osi.github.io/forms/NTAP/DSP_Standard_v1/DSP_Standard_v1.html
    DHART-SPORE https://docs.google.com/document/d/1JC8eNOS2bnrpIJhEX3zqLmqYTHUDF7Ui7xe139kBcCU https://github.com/nf-osi/forms/commit/96d6089ad83f95c55c9d1f997c0870ab96e6bf30 basic params + wording https://nf-osi.github.io/forms/DHART-SPORE/DSP_Standard_v1/DSP_Standard_v1.html
    GFF https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ib4RreL_UL7AC7NKgKFIu_8PBvJDeQxfNN7qDHh4GfI https://github.com/nf-osi/forms/commit/47735004847ff90d599d3f4322370c890b601059 basic params + new inputs + wording https://nf-osi.github.io/forms/GFF/DSP_Standard_v1/DSP_Standard_v1.html
